revised_title: Investigating the Cause of Damps in Mines: The Role of Candle Burning
tldr: The author conducts a series of experiments to determine if damps in mines can be caused solely by the burning of candles underground, even when the mine has a communication with the outside air. The results show that the presence of external air can prevent the extinguishing of the candle flame, suggesting that candle burning may contribute to the formation of damps.
